questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You have a dial plan that contains the following normalization rule:

• Pattern: ^8?(\d{7})$
• Translation: +1330$1

How will the phone numbers be normalized? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
None of the options in the dropdown are correct. A "?" before a digit implies the preceding digit can match 0 or more occurrences of that token. If the input is any 7 digits preceded with 8 or without 8, the regex will match. The translation +1330 is added at the beginning for every pattern that matches the regex, resulting in a complete E.164 format.
##############################
PowerShell Test:
##############################
PS C:\Users\PsScripts> ("85551212" -match "^8?(\d{7})$") 
True
PS C:\Users\PsScripts> ("5551212" -match "^8?(\d{7})$") 
True
##############################

The answer for both should be +13305551212 (CC-NPA-NXX-<4 digit extension>)
I believe the answer is +13305551212 in both instances. ? means match what's before the ? zero or more times. The $1 means reuse what is inside of the (), which is 7 digits.

choices.B: The user has the incorrect voice routing policy applied
choices.C: Enterprise Voice is disabled for the user
choices.D: The user has the incorrect Teams app setup policy applied
choices.A: The user is missing a validated emergency address

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that has 10 offices. Each office has a Session Border Controller (SBC).
A user reports that she can make internal calls by using the dial pad, but cannot use the dial pad to make external calls.
What is a possible cause of the issue?

comments.content: correct. there is nowhere where it is indicated that the dial pad is missing. user can use the dial pad to dial internal calls but not external calls.

discussion.content: B. They would have already been enterprise voice enabled, because they do see the dial pad.

Looking at:

 https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/troubleshoot/teams-conferencing/no-dial-pad

This could be B or C

comments.content: That article talks about "missing" dial pad. The question though simply states they can't make external calls.

discussion.content: Guess that was a Microsoft typo in the answer? They spelled Teams as "Leams" in the answer.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

Your company has a branch office named Branch1 that has limited network bandwidth.

The company has a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to limit the amount of data the Teams client utilizes when users are in Branch1.

How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
A. From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard select Tenant Data Upload and upload a CSV file that contains all the network sites.

Explanation:
Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard (CQD) uses uploaded network data to accurately report and analyze call quality based on network locations.
Tenant Data Upload is used to upload a CSV file that contains details about your network topology, including sites, subnets, and building information.
For the new site to appear in location-based reports, you need to upload a CSV file that includes all network sites. This ensures that the dashboard has a complete view of your network topology.
Uploading a CSV with all sites ensures that any missing data is corrected and all sites are correctly represented in the reports.
Option E (uploading a CSV file with the new network site only) might not update all necessary details in the CQD, leading to incomplete data. Therefore, uploading all network sites is the more comprehensive solution.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You deploy a new network site.

You discover that the new site is not listed in location-based reports. Other sites appear in the reports.

You need to ensure that all the sites appear in the reports.

What should you do?

choices.C: From Network planner in the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify an existing network plan.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, select Tenant Data Upload and upload a CSV file that contains the new network site only.
choices.A: From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard select Tenant Data Upload and upload a CSV file that contains all the network sites.
choices.B: From Network planner in the Microsoft Teams admin center, add a new persona.
choices.D: From Network planner in the Microsoft Teams admin center, add a new network plan.

discussion.content:
New York: 2 SBCs with local PSTN egress and HA configuration.
Calgary: 1 SBC with local PSTN egress and failover to New York's SBCs in case of failure.

Minimizing SBCs: By deploying 2 SBCs in New York (with HA) and 1 SBC in Calgary, you minimize the number of SBCs while ensuring local PSTN availability and failover capabilities.
High Availability: Ensures that if any SBC fails, there is always a backup in place, either locally (New York) or via the WAN (Calgary).
A single SBC in Calgary with two voice routes (VR1 and VR2). VR1 first priority to route calls to local SBC, VR2 lower priority to route calls to New York SBC.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Your company has a main office in New York and a branch office in Calgary. All offices connect to each other by using a dedicated WAN.

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You need to recommend a Direct Routing solution that meets the following requirements:

• If a Session Border Controller (SBC) fails in the New York office. PSTN services must remain available through a local PSTN egress in New York.
• The Calgary office must prioritize a local PSTN egress and ensure that PSTN services remain available in the event of a local SBC outage.
• The number of SBCs must be minimized.

What should you recommend for each office? To answer, drag the appropriate components to the correct offices. Each component may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
